intro: Wahlbergella longicarpophora, commonly known as the long-fruited Wahlbergella, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to South Africa, where it typically grows in rocky, coastal areas. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. Its fruit is a capsule that develops from the flower and contains numerous small seeds. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
